intro: Strobilanthes khasyana, commonly known as the Khasi flame flower, is a flowering plant native to the northeastern region of India. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that bloom in vibrant red or orange hues. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and undergrowth, preferring well-drained soil. Its flowering period is usually during the monsoon season, and it plays a significant role in the local ecosystem by attracting pollinators. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
